
# DataSource with autogenerated name

|||
|:-|:-|
| Id | **RDL0009**
| Mnemo | DATASOURCE_NAME_NODEFAULT
| Severity | ⚠ Warning
| Category | [Report](./Group_Report.md)
| Source code | [DatasourceReferenceNameAutoGeneratedRule.cs](../../../Rules/Reports/DatasourceReferenceNameAutoGeneratedRule.cs)

## Cause

This rule is triggered when a DataSource has an automatically generated name.
<p id="descr">Replace the DataSource name with a more meaningful one.</p>

## Examples

Bad

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Report MustUnderstand="df" xmlns="...">
  <DataSources>
    <DataSource Name="Datasource1">
    </DataSource>
  </DataSources>
</Report>
```

Good

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Report MustUnderstand="df" xmlns="...">
  <DataSources>
    <DataSource Name="MY_DS">
    </DataSource>
  </DataSources>
</Report>
```

## Tips

💡 A DataSource name is considered automatically generated if it matches one of the following patterns (case insensitive):

- datasourceXXX
- datasource XXX
- datasource-XXX

where XXX is a sequence number.
